commit_message:
Modify Nova API to reject invalid operations on physical servers

Physical servers provisioned by Ironic do not support certain variety of
operations that virtual servers provisioned by Nova do. But Nova still
allows to perform actions(pause, resize...) on physical servers that
can only be applied to virtual servers. We need to modify Nova API to
reject invalid operations on physical servers.

APIImpact

Related-Bug: #1483639
Blueprint reject-invalid-operation-on-physical-server

Change-Id: Ibfc7165c5f223cee944ec40390846d56b8657f66
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/04/283904/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================================== Modify Nova API to reject invalid operations on physical servers ================================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/reject-invalid-operation-on-physical-server Physical servers provisioned by Ironic do not support all variety of operations that virtual servers provisioned by Nova do. But Nova still allows to perform actions(pause, resize...) with physical servers that can only be applied to virtual servers. We need to modify Nova API to reject invalid operations on physical servers. Problem description =================== Currently in Nova API, physical servers and virtual servers share the resource controllers and the controllers treat the physical servers and virtual servers equally. This means all of the operations applied to virtual servers can be performed on physical servers via Nova API call. Many operations(like: snapshot, pause, resize, migrate and etc) are not applied to physical servers, but Nova API just accepts these commands silently rather than reject the request and prompts appropriate error messages. Use Cases --------- As an end user, I may perform invalid operation like 'resize' on physical server by mistake. If Nova API does NOT prompt any error messages, I will NOT realize that my request is invalid but thought that Nova has already done what I requested. Proposed change =============== Add a decorator to the related WSGI action method of the resource controllers, this decorator will distinguish whether the target resource is physical server or virtual server, and if it's physical server, the decorate will raise an exception and prompt error messages. Following are the action method need to be modified: <createImage> nova.api.openstack.compute.servers::ServersController._action_create_image <resize> nova.api.openstack.compute.servers::ServersController._action_resize <pause> nova.api.openstack.compute.pause_server::PauseServerController._pause <unpause> nova.api.openstack.compute.pause_server::PauseServerController._unpause <suspend> nova.api.openstack.compute.suspend_server::SuspendServerController._suspend <resume> nova.api.openstack.compute.suspend_server::SuspendServerController._resume <migrate> nova.api.openstack.compute.migrate_server::MigrateServerController._migrate <os-migrateLive> nova.api.openstack.compute.migrate_server:: MigrateServerController._migrate_live Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- The proposed change will update following Nova REST API: <createImage> <resize> <pause> <unpause> <suspend> <resume> <migrate> <os-migrateLive> If these action request was performed on physical servers, Nova API will reject the request and return http response code: '405 Method Not Allowed'. Example use case: When an end user issue a 'pause' request against a server via Nova API: Request: POST /servers/{id}/action -d '{"pause": null}' Response: Normal http response code: '202 Accepted' No response body is needed. Expected error http response code: '405 Method Not Allowed' - If the target server is a physical server, API server will return 405 Expected error http response code: '404 Not Found' Expected error http response code: '409 Conflict' Expected error http response code: '501 Not Implemented' Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Wenzhi Yu <wenzhi_yu@163.com> Other contributors: Bin Yu <froyo.bin@gmail.com> Work Items ---------- Add a new decorator in nova.api.openstack.wsgi.py which will reject operation request against physical servers. Update related WSGI action method in ServersController/PauseServerController/ SuspendServerController/MigrateServerController. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Add unit tests and API samples functional tests to test: When issue a invalid action request against physical servers, Nova API will reject the request and return http response code: '405 Method Not Allowed'. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== Originally reported as a bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1483639 History =======

commit_message:
Implements: blueprint multi-tenant-exclusion-filter

This is the inital specification for multi-tenant-exclusion-filter blueprint.
It defines a new filter that will be used to exclude tenants from host aggregates

Change-Id: I0e4b60b54f965fdfc151eafc2dd18d245d58f8eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/43/370243/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Multi Tenant Exclusion Filter ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/multi-tenant-exclusion-filter This specification proposes a new scheduler filter to exclude certian tenants from launching instances in a host aggregate. Problem description =================== The current AggregateMultiTenancyIsolation gives openstack administrators the ability to limit which tenants can launch instances in a given host aggregate. A aggregreate with the filter_tenant_id can only launch instsances from tenants that match the filter_tenant_id list. Any aggregate without the filter_tenant_id metadata key can launch instances from any tenant. This is useful for isolating certian projects to groups of hardware, for example load test teams, or sales teams performing customer demonstrations, while the majority of projects can use some generic aggregates, dedicated host aggregates can be reserved for these functions. The problem is that unless every host aggregate has a filter_tenant_id, you cannot guarntee the placement of certian instances. A exclusion filter is required that could be used in conjunction with the AggregateMultiTenancyIsolation, which would allow administrators to exclude tenants from certian host aggregates, while including them in others. Use Cases --------- Consider the following setup 3 Host aggregates, 2 of which have filter_tenant_ids host_aggregate_1 with filter_tenant_id=1,2 host_aggregate_2 with filter_tenant_id=1,2 host_aggregate_3 3 Projects, two specialised projects and general one. load_test_tenant id=1 sales_tenant id=2 developers_tenant=3 As a member of the `load_test` tenant when I launch an instance I want it to be created on `host_aggregate_1` or `host_aggregate_2` As a member of the `sales_tenant` when I launch an instance I want it to be create on `host_aggregate_1` or `host_aggregate_2` As a member of the `developer` tenant when I launch an instance I want it to be created in `host_aggregate_3` With the above, when a developer creates a new instance, it can only launch in host_aggregrate_3, therefore it will not interfere with work carrired out by the other two teams. When a member of load_test or sales tenant launches a instance, it will get launched in host_aggregate_1 or host_aggregate_2 because these specify the neccessary filter_tenant_ids. The problem is that the instance may also be launched in host_aggregate_3 which doesn't specifiy a filter_tenant_id. A new metadata property `exclude_tenant_id` should allow host_aggregate_3 to exclude both the sales_tenant and the load_test_tenant. Proposed change =============== This specifiction proposes a new scheduler filter, that uses the `exclude_tenant_id` metadata property to prevent tenants from launching instances within that host aggregate. Alternatives ------------ The exisiting AggregateMultiTenancyIsolation filter could be extended to support this use-case, however from a design perspective it is good practice to define each filter to do one well defined thing. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ This potentially introduces a new filter into the list of used filters, which adds additional latency to requests. Other deployer impact --------------------- A new filter may be added to the list of scheduler filters. Developer impact ---------------- none. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Who is leading the writing of the code? Or is this a blueprint where you're throwing it out there to see who picks it up? If more than one person is working on the implementation, please designate the primary author and contact. Primary assignee: dave-johnston Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- * Create new filter * Document the use of the filter Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= The use-case outlined in this specification should be tested. Documentation Impact ==================== The nova scheduler documentation must be updated to describe the new scheduler and how it is used. References ========== None. History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Newton - Introduced

commit_message:
Add network monitor for compute node

Nova blueprint 'utilization-aware-scheduling'[1] gave nova scheduler
the ability to schedule VMs based upon transient resource usage like
CPU utilization.

This blueprint proposes to add network monitor to collect network
related metrics on compute node. Resource tracker can get the metrics
from network monitor[2], then nova scheduler can schedule VMs based
upon the network utilization on compute node.

There was effort[3] trying to do this but it was obsoleted, this bp
will continue the work based on it.

[1]https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/utilization-aware-scheduling
[2]https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0.0rc1/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L464
[3]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/44007/

Blueprint add-network-monitor

Change-Id: Ib2149f2b86e2133c8e7c17f4b8ad40d01b06d436
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/11/297011/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================================== Add network monitor for compute node ====================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/add-network-monitor Nova scheduler already supports utilization based scheduling, like scheduling VMs based upon CPU utilization on compute node. This blueprint proposes to add a network monitor plugin to collect network related metrics for compute node so that nova scheduler can schedule VMs based upon network utilization on compute node. Problem description =================== Nova blueprint 'utilization-aware-scheduling'[1] gave nova scheduler the ability to schedule VMs based upon transient resource usage like CPU utilization. This blueprint proposes to add network monitor to collect network related metrics on compute node. Resource tracker can get the metrics from network monitor[2], then nova scheduler can schedule VMs based upon the network utilization on compute node. There was effort[3] trying to do this but it was obsoleted, this bp will continue the work based on it. [1]https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/utilization-aware-scheduling [2]https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0.0rc1/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L464 [3]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/44007/ Use Cases --------- As an user, I want to select compute node to boot my VMs based upon the network utilization on the compute nodes. Proposed change =============== Add network monitor 'nova.compute.monitors.network' to collect network related metrics on compute node. Network monitor can get network utilization info from compute node using psutil[4] library. Add network monitor entry point information into setup.cfg file. [4]https://pythonhosted.org/psutil/#network Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <yuywz> Work Items ---------- Add network monitor 'nova.compute.monitors.network'. Add related entry point for network monitor in setup.cfg Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Add new cases to nova.tests.unit.compute.monitors to test network monitor. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/add-network-monitor

commit_message:
Support SR-IOV and PCI statistics through Nova API

Change-Id: Ia776fc1915c591c2f5c26a0793da3cc78cd34f06
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/01/342001/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================= Support sriov and PCI statistics through Nova API ================================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/nova-api-sriov-pcipt-stats In the case of SR-IOV enabled cards, it is possible to treat any port on the card either as a number of virtual devices (called VFs - virtual functions) or as a full device (PF - physical function). Openstack supports both PF and VF configurations and it is supported in Newton release. The Nova API - nova hypervisor-show <compute-id> provides hypervisor information like vcpus, vcpus used, memory , used memory etc. Problem description =================== Right now there is no nova api that provides information about PCI devices. So user does not have option to check SRIOV VFs available, used etc. So we need to enhance the nova hypervisor-show <compute-id> to provide PCI device information. Use Cases ---------- As a cloud admin I would like to know how many PFs and VFs are available per compute-id for capacity management. As a cloud admin I also want to know the number of VFs and PFs available for a physical network(physnet). Proposed change =============== Enhance the existing Nova API nova hypervisor-show <compute-id> to provide information on PCI devices. The following information will be provided on PCI devices. 1. VFs configured: The number of VFs configured on a compute node. This is key value pair as show below. vfs: physnet1:<num_vfs_configred> physnet2:<num_vfs_configure> 2. VFs available: The number of VFs available on a computer node and their physical network. vfs_available : physnet1:<num_vfs_available> physnet2:<num_vfs_available> 3. PFs Configured: The number of PFs available on a compute node pfs: physnet1:<num_pfs_configred> physnet2:<num_pfs_configure> 4. PFs available: The number of PFs available on a compute node. pfs_available: physnet1:<num_pfs_available> physnet2:<num_pfs_available> The output of the nova hypervisor-show will be as follows: +---------------------------+------------------------------------------+ | Property | Value | +---------------------------+------------------------------------------+ | cpu_info_arch | x86_64 | | cpu_info_features | ["pge","clflush"] | | cpu_info_model | Haswell-noTSX | | cpu_info_topology_cells | 2 | | cpu_info_topology_cores | 6 | | cpu_info_topology_sockets | 1 | | cpu_info_topology_threads | 1 | | cpu_info_vendor | Intel | | current_workload | 0 | | disk_available_least | 675 | | free_disk_gb | 702 | | free_ram_mb | 123767 | | host_ip | 10.10.40.41 | | hypervisor_hostname | fake-mini | | hypervisor_type | QEMU | | hypervisor_version | 2005000 | | id | 1 | | local_gb | 732 | | local_gb_used | 30 | | memory_mb | 128631 | | memory_mb_used | 4864 | | running_vms | 1 | | service_disabled_reason | None | | service_host | 043b3cacf6f34c90a7245151fc8ebcda | | service_id | 2 | | state | up | | status | enabled | | vcpus | 12 | | vcpus_used | 1 | | vfs | { "physnet1": 8, "physnet2": 6 } | | vfs_available | { "physnet1": 5, "physnet2": 4 } | | pfs | { "physnet1": 2, "physnet2": 1 } | | pfs_avaialble | { "physnet1": 1, "physnet2": 0 } | +---------------------------+------------------------------------------+ Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- Response for the REST API GET /os-hypervisors/{hypervisor_id} will have new information on PCI devices. The sample json response after the addition of information on PCI devices will be as follows :: { "hypervisor": { "cpu_info": { "arch": "x86_64", "model": "Haswell-noTSX", "vendor": "Intel", "features": [ "pge", "clflush" ], "topology": { "cores": 1, "threads": 1, "sockets": 4 } }, "state": "up", "status": "enabled", "current_workload": 0, "disk_available_least": 675, "host_ip": "10.10.40.41", "free_disk_gb": 702, "free_ram_mb": 123767, "hypervisor_hostname": "fake-mini", "hypervisor_type": "fake", "hypervisor_version": 1000, "id": 1, "local_gb": 732, "local_gb_used": 30, "memory_mb": 128631, "memory_mb_used": 4864, "running_vms": 1, "service": { "host": "043b3cacf6f34c90a7245151fc8ebcda", "id": 2, "disabled_reason": null }, "vcpus": 12, "vcpus_used": 1 "vfs": [{"physical_network":"physnet1", "VF count":8}, {"physical_network":"physnet2", "VF count":6} ] "vfs_available": [{"physical_network":"physnet1", "VF count":5}, {"physical_network":"physnet2", "VF count":4} ] "pfs":[{"physical_network":"physnet1", "VF count":2}, {"physical_network":"physnet2", "VF count":1} ] "pfs_available":[{"physical_network":"physnet1", "VF count":1}, {"physical_network":"physnet2", "VF count":0} ] } } Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- No known deployer impact other than configuring the PCI whitelist for SR-IOV networking devices. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Sonu Sudhakaran <sonu.sudhakaran@hp.com> Other contributors: Raghuveer Shenoy <rshenoy@hp.com> Manjunath Patil <mpatil@hp.com> Work Items ---------- * Get the PCI device information for the compute node from database * The Nova REST API implementation adds additional information about the PCI devices on that compute. * Nova client API nova hypervisor-show is updated to display PCI devices information. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Test the REST APIs GET /os-hypervisors/{hypervisor_id} and check the new attributes * Test PCI device information using Nova API nova hpervisor-show <compute-id> Documentation Impact ==================== * Update user guide/wiki/doc to explain the details of the new attributes. References ========== https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/SR-IOV-Passthrough-For-Networking http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#hypervisors-os-hypervisors

commit_message:
FPGA Device Management

Change-Id: I22becd2cfd0af78dfd7b52ea44e81a6e80367504
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/30/323130/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ========================================== FPGA Device Management ========================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/fpga-device-management Problem description =================== FPGA (Field Programmable Gate Array) is a hardware physically presented like a GPU board that can be installed on a compute node and attached to a VM instance for workload acceleration. A FPGA, after installation, can be reloaded with different binaries so that its hardware circuit and function can be totally changed. For example, it can be changed from a Gzip accelerator to a JPEG decoder. Nova currently supports PCI-passthru for PCI devices using libvirt but it is not adequate for FPGA device management. First it does not support FPGA device reloading. Sometimes, we should not allow a user to reload a FPGA inside his/her VM because a FPGA usually doesn't support privileges (i.e. user mode vs kernel mode) like those provided by a modern processor. Loading a bad FPGA binary to a FPGA can result in unrecoverable physical damage to the device. For device safety, an API should be provided to cloud operator to reload the FPGA device in the host environment instead of exposing device reload to average users. For convenience, such an API should allow users to specify the FPGA device using a symbol name rather than its device name. Another problem is about the compatibility checking for a FPGA accelerator binary with a given FPGA device on each compute node. Due to the lack of an API to reload FPGA devices with new binaries, compatibility checking between an accelerator binary and a FPGA device is impossible. In fact, compatibility checking is more than a simple matching of the PCI device ID and vendor ID. Yet another problem is that the current PCI passthrough implementation is not considering the requirement of attaching devices to a container. Sometimes, one FPGA card (and also some GPUs) may be presented in OS as multiple devices. These said devices are created by host device drivers. It is desirable to attach such a group of Linux devices to a container VM to achieve performance goals. This group of Linux devices should be given a name and then used in OpenStack to as a single FPGA device in the context of containers. This blueprint treats FPGA as a configurable compute resource that allows reloading of accelerator binaries into FPGA devices, just like launching VMs with different images on a compute node. Both KVM and Linux container based VM are to be supported. Use Cases --------- When launching a VM instance, a user can attach either a FPGA device or a FPGA accelerator to the VM instance. If a FPGA device is attached, the FPGA device is a baremetal device, an API is provided to allow operators to reload the FPGA device with compatible binaries. After a FPGA accelerator is attached, the properties of the FPGA accelerator can be used to filter an available FPGA device on a compute node, and do the FPGA reloading before it returns the VM to user. The resource tracker in Nova Compute code will be changed to support the FPGA device definition and detection. It reports the architecture information to Nova database. New filters in Nova scheduler will be provied to filter the compute nodes for VMs with a requirement of FPGA device or FPGA accelerator. FPGA accelerator binaries are stored in Glance. Properties of Glance image are used to ensure the compatibility among FPGA accelerator binaries. New APIs are provided to allow operators to reload the FPGA accelerator binaries into a specified FPGA device. It is FPGA hardware manufactures' responsibility to provide method to cloud provider to do the FPGA accelerators binaries compatibility checking. It is cloud provider's responsibility to correctly define the FPGA device on each compute node and update the properties of FPGA accelerators binaries. The management of FPGA accelerator binaries in Glance is up to the cloud provider. It is not the scope of this spec/blueprint. Proposed change =============== This spec proposes the following changes to Nova: #. In Nova DB, the ``extra_resources`` column in the ``compute_nodes`` table is used to store the FPGA device information on each compute node:: { "fpga":[ { "name":"fpga_device_name1", "board":"board_name", "chip":"chip_name", "firmware":"6723-1234", }, { ... }, ... ] } #. In Nova DB, a new ``fpga_ref`` column is added to ``instances`` table to persist the FPGA device attachment information for each VM instance:: [ { "name":"fpga_device_name1", "board":"board_name", "chip":"chip_name", "firmware":"6723-1234", "binary":"fpga_image_id_in_glance" }, { ... } ] #. ``nova.conf`` and the resource tracking code of Nova compute need to be changed. FPGA device list is added to ``nova.conf``. An example of the device list is:: [fpga_devices] name = fpga_device_name board = board_name chip = chip_name detect_bin = /usr/bin/xxx_get_devices load_bin = /usr/bin/xxx_reload board = some_name chip = some_name firmware = 6723-1234 device = /dev/fpga0,dev/fpga_ctl passthrough = docker Nova resource tracking code is changed to do resource detection according to the ``fpga_devices`` section in ``nova.conf``. Some FPGA binary tool can be specified in ``nova.conf`` to help device detection and accelerator reloading. #. API for VM instance creating is changed with new parameters specifying the FPGA accelerator or the FPGA device to be attached to the VM instance. #. Extra filter in Nova scheduler is added so that it can find a compute node with the compatible FPGA board. It is scheduled according to the FPGA accelerator properties in VM instance creation API and the resource information in Nova DB. #. API for VM instance update is changed to support FPGA accelerator binary reload on compute nodes. The API first fetches accelerator binary from Glance using existing APIs, then reload the accelerators using the binary tool specified in nova.conf. #. VM instance driver is changed to passing through FPGA PCI devices to KVM VM or attach FPGA device to container VM. It also executes the accelerator reloading. It is a simple extension of existing PCI pass through code in KVM instance driver. Alternatives ------------ OpenStack currently supports pass-through PCI devices to VM instances, but the existing code base is not sufficient for reconfigurable device like FPGA. Based on the discussions above, we believe there is no alternative to meet the requirements for FPGA device management. Data model impact ----------------- #. In Nova DB, the ``extra_resources`` column in the ``compute_nodes`` table is used to store the FPGA device information on each compute node:: { "fpga":[{ "name": "fpga_device_name1", "board": "board_name", "chip": "chip_name", "firmware": "6723-1234" }] } #. In Nova DB, a new ``fpga_ref`` column is added to the ``instances`` table to keep the FPGA device attachment information for each VM instance:: { "name": "fpga_device_name1", "board": "board_name", "chip": "chip_name", "firmware": "6723-1234", "binary": "fpga_image_id_in_glance" } REST API impact --------------- Each API method which is either added or changed should have the following #. Compute API - create server is changed to attach an FPGA device to the VM and also load an accelerator image to the attached FPGA device:: Method type: POST Normal http response codes: Unchanged Expected error http response codes: Unchanged URL for the resource: Unchanged Parameters which can be passed via the url: None JSON schema definition for the request body data: "fpgaRef":[{"device_name":"xxxx", "binary":"glance_id"},] JSON schema definition for the response body data: Unchanged #. FPGA reload API - Nova update server API is reused to reload a FPGA accelerator binary to the FPGA device which is already attached to the instance:: Method type: PUT Normal http response codes: 202 Expected error http response codes: serviceUnavailable(503), badRequest(400), unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404) URL for the resource: /v2.1/{tenant_id}/servers/{server_id} Parameters which can be passed via the url: None JSON schema definition for the request body data:: { "server":{ "device_name":"new_fpga_accelerator_glance_id" } } JSON schema definition for the response body data: Unchanged Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ Scheduler filters for FPGA device and FPGA accelerator matching is called once per host for every instance created, so the latency introduced is linear to the number of instances launched. The FPGA accelerator reloading takes some time. It is invoked during VM creation if user has specified a FPGA accelerator binary to be attached. The time is usually less than 60 seconds, sometimes less than 1 second. Other deployer impact --------------------- The upgrade of OpenStack will not have any impact on existing instances that are already created. It essentially extend the resource for creating instance so it is only activated when the API explicitly attaches the new FPGA resource to an instance. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Fei Chen <uchen@cn.ibm.com>. Work Items ---------- * Augment the Nova DB model to add a ``fpga_ref`` column to instance table * Change the ``nova.conf`` parser and Nova compute resource tracker to track FPGA devices to Nova DB. * Change Nova server create API to add FPGA device and accelerator attachment parameter(s). * Add new filters to the Nova scheduler for match FPGA devices on compute nodes. * Add new API to allow FPGA binary reloading. * Change instance driver to support FPGA device attachment and FPGA binary reloading. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Changes proposed here only extend existing functionality, so they will require updating the current test suite to make sure new functionality is covered. By adding a simulation driver to the Linux environment, testing can be launch without real FPGA card. Documentation Impact ==================== Document for Nova server creation and server update need to be updated to support the FPGA device attachment and FPGA accelerator reloading. References ========== None History ======= None

commit_message:
Report Host Memory and Disk Info

This proposal is to report host memory and disk total/used information to
Ceilometer by notifications.

Implements: blueprint report-host-memory-disk-info

Change-Id: I51bbf355e48d8797814ae6d0f3a1a1d7016509a2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/58/308858/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================================== Report Host Memory and Disk Info =================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/report-host-memory-disk-info This proposal is to report host memory and disk total/used information to Ceilometer by notifications. Problem description =================== Currently Nova has reported host cpu information to Ceilometer, like compute.node.cpu.percent etc. but lack of memory and disk information, hope also increase host memory and disk total/used information. Use Cases ---------- Heat need to triger vm autoscale and migration based on host cpu/memory/disk information, for example, a host memory usage is too high, then migrate vms on it. Proposed change =============== We propose the following changes to the Nova code base: 1) Report host memory total/ memory used/ disk total/ disk used information by notifications in Nova-compute resource tracker procedure. Alternatives ------------ None. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- Add a new notification to report host memory and disk information periodically. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: zhang-shaoman Other contributors: Work Items ---------- 1) Get host memory total/ memory used/ disk total/ disk used information in resource tracker procedure, and report with an extra notification. Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= Should add unit tests with new notification. Documentation Impact ==================== None. No user-facing changes. References ========== None. History ======= None.

commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example).
To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: Ieb68867726f8959ac5dc0f48fa923281cd2134fa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/45/390745/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-21 20:25:03.000000000', 'files': ['designate/tests/unit/test_agent/test_backends/test_msdns.py', 'designate/tests/test_agent/test_backends/test_djbdns.py', 'designate/tests/unit/test_agent/test_backends/test_djbdns.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/e5f6ef7e1e6ae3ff8fd71b2628b2fe9a681c3548', 'message': 'Fix unit tests for oslo.config 3.18.0

The unit tests were improperly overriding the server list with a tuple
rather than a list. In newer versions of oslo.config they are no longer

Closes-Bug: #1635717

commit_message:
Fix unit tests for oslo.config 3.18.0

The unit tests were improperly overriding the server list with a tuple
rather than a list. In newer versions of oslo.config they are no longer
converting the values which leads to unit test failures. This change
updates the unit tests to use a list for the server override.

Change-Id: I429417e26eb535560821cc8e31dbecc9f1d26e6d
Closes-Bug: #1635717

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-18 06:16:52.000000000', 'files': ['functionaltests/common/models.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/e3efbe15948ffcced9b98d66dac9c9b0000a17aa', 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I1777e08e723ec6efc8f10fa86b01220aaa108c41
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I1777e08e723ec6efc8f10fa86b01220aaa108c41
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/03/387803/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __ne__(self, other): return not self.__eq__(other) def __ne__(self, other): return not self.__eq__(other)

commit_message:
Default ethertype to IPv4 if Neutron's enable_ipv6 is false

* When OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK's enable_ipv6 is set to False set
* ethertype to IPv4 and also assign IP version of CIDR to IPv4.

Change-Id: I37eeccc46fc54e9790634a70e0148bda2f537c7d
Closes-bug: #1631551

commit_message:
Expose Horizon / API Ports on host

Set the vagrant file to expose required ports on the host

Also enable setting Host Header support as part of devstack
(required for using the V2 API + OSC CLI from the host)

Change-Id: Ib3288181d9acfe41551820196d7704c4cebabdc8

subject: Mark oslo.vmware as optional dependency
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-05 23:29:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/7c15fff6be8027663e515d136a8e2c532f1be920', 'message': 'Mark oslo.vmware as optional dependency

A driver specific requirement module should not be a hard requirement,
since the choice of drivers is based on operator. oslo.vmware module
is to be moved out of the requirements.txt and instead listed as
optional dependecy using extras functionality in setup.cfg.

A check is added to the vmdk driver to gracefully handle import errors
if the vmdk driver is used and oslo.vmware is not found.

commit_message:
Mark oslo.vmware as optional dependency

A driver specific requirement module should not be a hard requirement,
since the choice of drivers is based on operator. oslo.vmware module
is to be moved out of the requirements.txt and instead listed as
optional dependency using extras functionality in setup.cfg.

A check is added to the vmdk driver to gracefully handle import errors
if the vmdk driver is used and oslo.vmware is not found. Unit test
is added to verify check on vmdk driver.

Change-Id: I358a717533469559d96381a420fe7faf7918649d
Closes-Bug: #1513212

commit_message:
zone_name is null in zone trasfer request response

The response to API call has zone_id set with
zone id but zone name is set to 'null'.

Change-Id: Id2d093891953efcbb125560ea1113b8a9e613a9c
Closes-Bug: #1580014

added_lines: zone = self.central_api.get_zone(context, zone_id) body['zone_name'] = zone.name

commit_message:
Add --get <key> option to `swift capabilities` / `swift info`

This allows us to do things like:

    $ swift info --get swift.version
    2.5.1.dev274

    $ MAX_SIZE=`swift info --get swift.max_file_size`
    $ SEG_SIZE=`bc <<< "$MAX_SIZE / 20"`
    $ swift upload -S $SEG_SIZE ...

    $ swift info --get slo > /dev/null 2> /dev/null
    $ if [ $? -eq 2 ]; then SWIFT_ARGS="$SWIFT_ARGS --use-slo"; fi

Change-Id: Ide98b862c3b511ba169ff45067e3910c6e1ab953
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient refs/changes/43/276043/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: \fBcapabilities\fR [\fIcommand-options\fR] [\fIproxy-url\fR]Displays cluster capabilities. If the proxy-url option is not provided the storage-url retrieved after authentication is used as proxy-url. By default, the output includes the list of the activated Swift middlewares as well as relevant options for each one. Additionally the command displays relevant options for the Swift core. The -g <key> or --get <key> option will instead only print the value of <key> for the cluster. If <key> is not found, exit with status 1. If <key> is found but is not a simple value, exit with status 2. This may be used to determine specific capabilities when scripting. \fBExample\fR: capabilities https://swift.example.com capabilities \-g swift.version
deleted_lines: \fBcapabilities\fR [\fIproxy-url\fR]Displays cluster capabilities. The output includes the list of the activated Swift middlewares as well as relevant options for each ones. Addtionaly the command displays relevant options for the Swift core. If the proxy-url option is not provided the storage-url retrieved after authentication is used as proxy-url.

subject: Fix database poison warnings, part 22
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-27 19:09:43.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_quotas.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/993a815e78d9a500bd187f4ce25c0a5826369b23', 'message': 'Fix database poison warnings, part 22

The following warning appears in the unit test logs a number of times.

    "UserWarning: This test uses methods that set internal oslo_db
state, but it does not claim to use the database. This will conflict
with the setup of tests that do use the database and cause failures
later."

This patch fixes all the warnings from:

    nova.tests.unit.api.openstack.compute.test_quotas.py

Note that this warning is only emitted once per unit test worker, so new
offenders will show up in the logs each time you fix a test until they
are all gone.

Change-Id: I1f6d5e161abea3a66fe09159b84e100c123561bd
Related-Bug: #1568414
'}]
commit_message:
Fix database poison warnings, part 22

The following warning appears in the unit test logs a number of times.

    "UserWarning: This test uses methods that set internal oslo_db
state, but it does not claim to use the database. This will conflict
with the setup of tests that do use the database and cause failures
later."

This patch fixes all the warnings from:

    nova.tests.unit.api.openstack.compute.test_quotas.py

Note that this warning is only emitted once per unit test worker, so new
offenders will show up in the logs each time you fix a test until they
are all gone.

Change-Id: I1f6d5e161abea3a66fe09159b84e100c123561bd
Related-Bug: #1568414

commit_message:
Set dns extension driver

Dns-integration extension was disabled by default in neutron,
we must set it explisitly

Change-Id: I7a9aae67a6f567f9a6049bcdf96195775de8a16b
Closes-Bug: #1628540

commit_message:
microversion selector - dropdown

This does a few things:

* Change from button list to a select combo box.
** This allows users to type the number they want
* Add the ablity to tag versions to releases
** E.G. Say mitaka was released with 2.27, it will
   show in the list as "2.27 - Mitaka".
** This currently set as a config option in
   conf.py as a dict like:

  os_api_ref_release_microversions = {
      '2.27' : 'mitaka',
      '2.10': 'liberty'
  }

* Uses https://github.com/danielfarrell/bootstrap-combobox
** Apache Licenced

Change-Id: Ica7dd55cdbf413f03ea635aefb627a705132a73e

commit_message:
Clarify what changed with scheduler_host_manager.

The wording could be interpreted as the full removal of the
scheduler_host_manager configuration entry itself.

Change-Id: Ifd8269ae3467f1828ea2d6764cd42446be6de5a0

commit_message:
Add possibility to reserve IP address for specific nodes

- In the YAML template section 'address_pools', IP address for
  a specific node can be specified in the 'ip_reserved' field:
  <group_name>_<node_name>: <ip_address>

  For example:

    address_pools:
      public-pool01:
        net: 172.16.10.0/24:24
        params:
          ip_reserved:
            gateway: +1
            l2_network_device: +1
            default_cfg01.mk22-lab-advanced.local: 172.16.10.100
            default_ctl01.mk22-lab-advanced.local: +101
            default_ctl02.mk22-lab-advanced.local: +102
            default_ctl03.mk22-lab-advanced.local: +103
          ip_ranges:
            dhcp: [+100, -2]

- Erase the failed environment in case of creation failure, to not
  leave inconsistent objects on host and in database.

Change-Id: Ic53f1f69d718998448b6f26fe46b4e8130addbb1

commit_message:
Fix policy file used for testing

The policy file is hard coded to the fake one which is used for
unit tests. This patch fixes it by providing the possibility to
overwrite the default value and use the real policy files for the
in-tree functional tests.

Closes-Bug: #1606715
Change-Id: I6f9b856c13ee1264de892aabe7fdb824db8f2cf1

commit_message:
Removing token revoke / delete calls

Keysonte is changing the nature of tokens, timeouts, and long
running tasks.  In addition, horizon can also cause issues where
a user starts a long running tasks, logs out, and then the token
fails authenticaion.   Just removing this problematic logic.

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/session-extendable-tokens

Closes-Bug: #1637460
Change-Id: I5eda08e95d8df72ba601181f02a72de37c5393fd

subject: Fix same-host offline install race
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-20 16:21:59.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/install_offline.yml', 'tasks/install_source.yml', 'handlers/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-pip_install/commit/d3a2adc67cac9a48f0de96e2e14f7faf1d0cf5b4', 'message': 'Fix same-host offline install race

When pip_offline_install is used on a deployment such as an AIO where
the host being installed to ie. "aio1" is also the deployment host,
a race condition existed where the pip wheels would be downloaded,
uploaded to the same path on the target host, and then cleaned up
from the deployment host before the installation was continued.

The result is a race condition where the wheels are removed from
the target prior to installation due to the target being local.

This changes the pip offline install cleanup to run as a handler
so the cleanup can take place after the role has completed its work
with the cached wheels.

Change-Id: Ibf36118d42950f0f64f83b6ffc3601c9a241289d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix same-host offline install race

When pip_offline_install is used on a deployment such as an AIO where
the host being installed to ie. "aio1" is also the deployment host,
a race condition existed where the pip wheels would be downloaded,
uploaded to the same path on the target host, and then cleaned up
from the deployment host before the installation was continued.

The result is a race condition where the wheels are removed from
the target prior to installation due to the target being local.

This changes the pip offline install cleanup to run as a handler
so the cleanup can take place after the role has completed its work
with the cached wheels.

Change-Id: Ibf36118d42950f0f64f83b6ffc3601c9a241289d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-pip_install refs/changes/69/389269/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- # Copyright 2016, Logan Vig <logan2211@gmail.com> # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. - name: Clean up local get-pip.py local_action: module: file path: "/tmp/get-pip.py" state: absent run_once: yes tags: - pip-install-cleanup - name: Clean up local install cache local_action: module: file path: "{{ pip_tmp_packages }}" state: absent run_once: yes tags: - pip-install-cleanup - name: Clean up remote install files file: path: "{{ pip_tmp_packages }}" state: absent tags: - pip-install-cleanup

commit_message:
Cisco Standalone fabric horizon GUI

Extended Horizon Cisco UI for supporting Network Configuration Profile
for Nexus Programmable Fabric

Change-Id: I66381ec1a04b098eed27101dc55551776c8a1e3a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon-cisco-ui refs/changes/01/356101/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import logging from django.utils.translation import ugettext_lazy as _ from horizon import exceptions from horizon import forms from horizon import workflows from horizon_cisco_ui.cisco.dfa import dfa_client from openstack_dashboard import api from openstack_dashboard.dashboards.project.networks import \ workflows as upstream_networks_workflows LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class DFAConfigProfileAction(workflows.Action): cfg_profile = forms.ChoiceField(label=_("Config Profile"), required=False) def __init__(self, request, *args, **kwargs): super(DFAConfigProfileAction, self).__init__(request, *args, **kwargs) self.fields['cfg_profile'].choices = \ self.get_config_profile_choices(request) def get_config_profile_choices(self, request): profile_choices = [('', _("Select a config profile"))] for profile in self._get_cfg_profiles(request): profile_choices.append((profile, profile)) return profile_choices def _get_cfg_profiles(self, request): profiles = [] try: dc = dfa_client.dfa_client() profiles = dc.get_all_config_profiles() except Exception as exc: exceptions.handle(request, exc.message) return profiles class Meta(object): name = _("DFA") help_text = _("Select Network Configuration Profile from the list " "to associate with your network.") class DFAConfigProfileInfo(workflows.Step): action_class = DFAConfigProfileAction def contribute(self, data, context): for k, v in data.items(): context[k] = v return context class DFACreateNetwork(upstream_networks_workflows.CreateNetwork): default_steps = (upstream_networks_workflows.CreateNetworkInfo, upstream_networks_workflows.CreateSubnetInfo, upstream_networks_workflows.CreateSubnetDetail, DFAConfigProfileInfo) @staticmethod def _create_network(self, request, data): try: params = {'name': data['net_name'], 'admin_state_up': (data['admin_state'] == 'True'), 'shared': data['shared']} if api.neutron.is_port_profiles_supported(): params['net_profile_id'] = data['net_profile_id'] network = api.neutron.network_create(request, **params) self.context['net_id'] = network.id msg = (_('Network "%s" was successfully created.') % network.name_or_id) LOG.debug(msg) return network except Exception as e: msg = (_('Failed to create network "%(network)s": %(reason)s') % {"network": data['net_name'], "reason": e}) LOG.info(msg) # Delete Precreated Network try: precreate_network = dict(tenant_id=request.user.project_id, nwk_name=data['net_name'], subnet=data['cidr'], cfgp=data['cfg_profile']) dc = dfa_client.dfa_client() dc.do_delete_precreate_network(precreate_network) precreate_flag = False except Exception as exc: LOG.error('Unable to do delete precreate Network') exceptions.handle(self.request, exc.message) redirect = self.get_failure_url() exceptions.handle(request, msg, redirect=redirect) return False @staticmethod def handle(self, request, data): precreate_flag = False precreate_network = dict(tenant_id=request.user.project_id, nwk_name=data['net_name'], subnet=data['cidr'], cfgp=data['cfg_profile']) dc = dfa_client.dfa_client() if data['cfg_profile']: '''Pre-create network in enabler''' try: dc.do_precreate_network(precreate_network) precreate_flag = True except Exception as exc: LOG.error('Unable to do precreate Network') exceptions.handle(self.request, exc.message) return False network = self._create_network(request, data) if not network: if precreate_flag: # do precreate delete try: dc.do_delete_precreate_network(precreate_network) precreate_flag = False except Exception as exc: LOG.error('Unable to do delete precreate Network') exceptions.handle(self.request, exc.message) return False # If we do not need to create a subnet, return here. if not data['with_subnet']: return True subnet = self._create_subnet(request, data, network, no_redirect=True) if subnet: return True else: self._delete_network(request, network) if precreate_flag: # do precreate delete try: dc.do_delete_precreate_network(precreate_network) precreate_flag = False except Exception as exc: LOG.error('Unable to do delete precreate Network') exceptions.handle(self.request, exc.message) return False

commit_message:
Add nova.ListAndSearchHypervisors scenario

List all servers belonging to specific hypervisor.

The scenario first list all hypervisors,then find its hostname,
then list all servers belonging to the hypervisor
Measure the "nova hypervisor-servers <hostname>" command performance.

Change-Id: I8511a9790037ee5f3bab003309f2debe31b00590

commit_message:
Transform instance.resume notifications

The instance.resume.start and instance.resume.end notifications
are transformed to the versioned framework using the generic
InstanceActionNotification and InstanceActionPayload class.

Implements: bp versioned-notification-transformation-ocata

Change-Id: I923971ea2f6c1f450ace27b246aa6f372a72bb30

commit_message:
Bump hacking to 0.11.0 in test-requirements

Hacking's latest release is 0.11.0. Most other ironic projects are using
this release.

These updates are done project-by-project to avoid introducing
unexpected new hacking rules to projects. This version bump already
applies cleanly to ironic-lib with no code style changes.

Change-Id: I6e47390299bf8f073b8c8413f0cd4e1365f938bb

commit_message:
Change 'writeable' to 'writable'

'writable' is more common than 'writeable' in the commit message.
 http://wikidiff.com/writable/writeable

Change-Id: I45aa36014f910f34e6d1a6bb3488887482c80ce3

commit_message:
Added policy checks for Project>Volumes Panel

Before if a user/operator wanted to restrict access to the Volumes
Panel via the policy.json file by setting these values to:
"volume:get_all": "rule:context_is_admin"
nothing happened after restarting horizon.
This patch adds the policy checks so the access to the Volumes panel
be restricted by changing the cinder_policy.json file

Change-Id: Ibc53be505a053353062c03ea5d31e9fd800a5dcb
Closes-Bug: #1579111
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/10/339110/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import logging from openstack_dashboard import policy LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def allowed(self, context): request = context['request'] get_all = policy.check((("volume", "volume:get_all"),), request) create = policy.check((("volume", "volume:create"),), request) if not get_all and not create: return False return super(Volumes, self).allowed(context)

commit_message:
Add support for db_max_retries param

The db_max_retries parameter regulates the number of reconnection
attempts performed after an error raised rather than at startup.

Change-Id: Ib4a04482f7b67b4b38a91031ba9a25670e52d91b
Closes-Bug: 1579718

commit_message:
Update test of policy

Update the tests to properly use rspec-puppet-facts and
on_supported_os for policy

Change-Id: Ia48c984814bac2933c0532ca065e70e20ad2de84
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ec2api refs/changes/46/391246/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: shared_examples_for 'ec2api policies' do let :params do { :policy_path => '/etc/ec2api/policy.json', :policies => { 'context_is_admin' => { 'key' => 'context_is_admin', 'value' => 'foo:bar' } } } end it 'set up the policies' do is_expected.to contain_openstacklib__policy__base('context_is_admin').with({ :key => 'context_is_admin', :value => 'foo:bar' }) is_expected.to contain_ec2api_config('oslo_policy/policy_file').with_value('/etc/ec2api/policy.json') on_supported_os({ :supported_os => OSDefaults.get_supported_os }).each do |os,facts| context "on #{os}" do let (:facts) do facts.merge!(OSDefaults.get_facts()) end it_configures 'ec2api policies' end end
deleted_lines: on_supported_os(supported_os: OSDefaults.get_supported_os).each do |os,facts| context "on #{os}" do let(:facts) { facts.merge! @default_facts } describe 'with default parameters' do it { is_expected.to compile.with_all_deps } it { is_expected.to contain_class('ec2api::policy') } end describe 'with custom parameters' do let(:params) do { policies: {}, policy_path: '/etc/ec2api/policy.json', } end it { is_expected.to compile.with_all_deps } it { is_expected.to contain_class('ec2api::policy') } end end

commit_message:
Add probetest for container replicator

Change-Id: I68599e2fa8993cb5b84f115a606968af6adcd654
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/89/391089/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from swiftclient.exceptions import ClientException as SwiftClientExceptionfrom swift.common.manager import Manager def test_container_replication_after_recovery(self): # In this test, we need to put container at handoff devices, so we # need container devices more than replica count if len(self.container_ring.devs) <= self.container_ring.replica_count: raise SkipTest('Need devices more that replica count') container = 'container-%s' % uuid4() cpart, cnodes = self.container_ring.get_nodes(self.account, container) # Kill all primary container servers for cnode in cnodes: kill_server((cnode['ip'], cnode['port']), self.ipport2server) # Create container, and all of its replicas are placed at handoff # device try: client.put_container(self.url, self.token, container) except SwiftClientException as err: # if the cluster doesn't have enough devices, swift may return # error (ex. When we only have 4 devices in 3-replica cluster). self.assertEqual(err.http_status, 503) # Assert handoff device has a container replica another_cnode = self.container_ring.get_more_nodes(cpart).next() direct_client.direct_get_container( another_cnode, cpart, self.account, container) # Restart all primary container servers for cnode in cnodes: start_server((cnode['ip'], cnode['port']), self.ipport2server) # Run the container-replicator, and now, container replicas # at handoff device get moved to primary servers Manager(['container-replicator']).once() # Assert that the handoff device does not have replica another_node = self.container_ring.get_more_nodes(cpart).next() try: direct_client.direct_get_container( another_cnode, cpart, self.account, container) except ClientException as err: self.assertEqual(err.http_status, 404) else: self.fail('Handoff replica still remains') # Assert that the primary servers has the container replica, # just moved by replicator for cnode in cnodes: direct_client.direct_get_container( cnode, cpart, self.account, container)

Imported Translations from Zanata

commit_message:
Move rbd_default_features to ensure_resources

We are working to land I477640c5db2cc84622da7734fb54cfe7740bd137
which creates a duplicate declration, we should be able to move from create
to ensure resource to minimize this until it lands.

Related_bug: 1633552

Change-Id: I95cafec9160f5c3b1610a0408f2f80d567fcaa89

commit_message:
Add extra_info field to the resource database table of plan API

Add the extra_info field to the resource database table of
plan API datamodule. User can save the extra_info of resourece
instances to this table.

blueprint instances-extra-info

Change-Id: I6a90b2c178afe96f321ff1a6a7e3623ae19e11bf

commit_message:
Fix the ctlplane-ip-range validation

This adds "become: true" to the undercloud.conf task, because that file
may not always be accessible by the validations user.

Closes-Bug: #1637254

commit_message:
Create secretutils and include 'constant_time_compare' function

This code (or a version of it) is being shared by at least nova
and keystonemiddleware and it seems like a good idea to move it
to being common shared code (especially due to the importance
of getting this code correct).

This adds an initial secretutils and adds tests for it.

Change-Id: Ia603202a065d5b345608e712f63f7af21fd74dea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.utils refs/changes/18/227018/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import hmac import six from six.moves import zip as compat_zip try: constant_time_compare = hmac.compare_digest except AttributeError: def constant_time_compare(first, second): """Returns True if both string inputs are equal, otherwise False. This function should take a constant amount of time regardless of how many characters in the strings match. This function uses an approach designed to prevent timing analysis by avoiding content-based short circuiting behaviour, making it appropriate for cryptography. """ if len(first) != len(second): return False result = 0 if six.PY3 and isinstance(first, six.binary_type) and \ isinstance(second, six.binary_type): for x, y in compat_zip(first, second): result |= x ^ y else: for x, y in compat_zip(first, second): result |= ord(x) ^ ord(y) return result == 0

As in I2c13d28c54ae3a9ff562448e7a16ab54d71b29b5, assertGreater/
assertGreaterEqual provides a nicer error message when failing if

This is to fix other occurrences of this kind.

'}]
commit_message:
Use assertGreater(Equal) over assertTrue

As in I2c13d28c54ae3a9ff562448e7a16ab54d71b29b5, assertGreater/
assertGreaterEqual provides a nicer error message when failing if
no additional error message is specified.
This is to fix other occurrences of this kind.

Change-Id: I17a55f37026e26355a214541776975ad2efe70b2

commit_message:
Fix bug in "nova/tests/unit/virt/test_virt_drivers.py" for os-vif

Commit 735f710 moved the os_vif.initialize() code. This lead to an
error in "test_virt_drivers.LibvirtConnTestCase.test_set_admin_password":

  AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'vif

This change initializes os_vif in "test_virt_driver" as it was done
for "libvirt.test_driver" in commit 735f710.

Change-Id: Idf2fcb1df92dd4aa1761d955ea149090263d42d8
Closes-Bug: #1632987
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/22/385822/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import os_vif os_vif.initialize()

commit_message:
Update docs for serial console support

There are two changes here:

1. The serial_console config option group help text is
   updated to point out that hyper-v also supports serial
   console access. This is based on virt drivers that
   implement the 'get_serial_console' method.

2. The hypervisor feature matrix is updated to point out
   that the vmware driver does not support getting serial
   console output. This is based on virt drivers that
   implement the 'get_console_output' method.

Closes-Bug: #1632135

Change-Id: Ibf7f865e2b768e5ea3d7a7ec7cbf77bd8997c50f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/28/384728/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: currently supported for the libvirt and hyper-v drivers.""")

Utilice OS::Heat::" "SoftwareDeploymentGroup en su lugar." msgid "" "Use of this resource is discouraged. Utilice OS::Heat::" "StructuredDeploymentGroup en su lugar." msgid ""msgid "Use value_name only for replacing list elements." msgstr "Utilice value_name solo para reemplazar elementos de lista." msgid "Using Cinder API V1, volume type access" msgstr "Utilizando Cinder API V1, el acceso de tipo de volumen" msgid "Using Cinder API V1, volume_type update" msgstr "Utilizando la API de Cinder V1, actualizar el volume_type" msgid "" "When this feature is enabled, scheduler hints identifying the heat stack " "context of a server or volume resource are passed to the configured " "schedulers in nova and cinder, for creates done using heat resource types " "OS::Cinder::Volume, OS::Nova::Server, and AWS::EC2::Instance. " "heat_root_stack_id will be set to the id of the root stack of the resource, " "heat_stack_id will be set to the id of the resource's parent stack, " "heat_stack_name will be set to the name of the resource's parent stack, " "heat_path_in_stack will be set to a list of tuples, (stackresourcename, " "stackname) with list[0] being (None, rootstackname), heat_resource_name will " "be set to the resource's name, and heat_resource_uuid will be set to the " "resource's orchestration id." msgstr "" "Cuando esta caracterstica est habilitada, se pasan sugerencias de " "planificador que identifican el contexto de pila de heat de un recurso de " "servidor o de volumen a los planificadores configurados en nova y cinder, " "para creaciones realizadas utilizando los tipos de recurso de heat OS::" "Cinder::Volume, OS::Nova::Server y AWS::EC2::Instance. heat_root_stack_id se " "definir con el ID de la pila raz del recurso, heat_stack_id se definir " "con el ID de la pila padre del recurso, heat_stack_name se definir con el " "nombre la pila padre del recurso, heat_path_in_stack se definir con una " "lista de tuplas, (stackresourcename, stackname) donde list[0] ser (None, " "rootstackname), heat_resource_name se definir con el nombre del recurso y " "heat_resource_uuid se definir con el ID de orquestacin del recurso ." msgid "" "Whether allow the volume to be attached more than once. added_lines: {%- if pillar.neutron.server.enabled %} {%- from "neutron/map.jinja" import server with context %} remote_plugin: openstack_neutron: plugin: python template: neutron/files/collectd_openstack_neutron.conf url: "http://{{ server.identity.host }}:{{ server.identity.port }}/v{% if server.identity.get('api_version', 2)|int == 2 %}2.0{% else %}3{% endif %}" username: {{ server.identity.user }} password: {{ server.identity.password }} tenant: {{ server.identity.tenant }} {%- endif %}

commit_message:
Prefill Sensu client custom config

- Custom config has to contain OpenStack auth information,
  so it has to be generated for user during deployment.
  This patch maintains the ability to provide a custom
  configuration for the Sensu client.

Change-Id: If449642c4bbad683421e1f461b8721e655db0c45
(cherry picked from commit 9d9eecea56b15f6f96f9d33def8045afb6527051)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/43/390843/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add py_req_cleanup macro to all Python spec templates

Fedora specs use to remove requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt
during %prep, to prevent any attempt to download from PyPi while building.

We now have a py_req_cleanup macro in openstack-macros, so let's use it.
This will only change the outcome in packages using centos.

Change-Id: I7d7a27d4909990a9d26433cd65e799cae3af7904
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging refs/changes/49/385049/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% block req_cleanup %}{% endblock %}

commit_message:
Fix log translation marker in volume/utils.py

Fixing the case where _LE() is used to mark an exception
message. We should use _() to mark exception messages.

Change-Id: I4f2ad54818427b37ca60fcca1d4955bf72c83e5d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/88/383688/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: msg = _LE("volume is not assigned to a host")
